column4: Brazilian food processor BRF posts 1.4 bln real net profit

column5: Feb 26 Canadian stock futures extended gains on Friday after data showed U.S. economic growth slowed less sharply than expected in the fourth quarter.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Futures point to higher open as oil rises
column5: Feb 26 Canada's main stock index looked set to follow global markets higher as oil prices rose and investors focused on a meeting of G-20 leaders that kicked off in Shanghai on Friday.

column4: Auto parts maker Magna's profit falls due to strong U.S. dollar
column5: Feb 26 Canadian auto parts maker Magna International Inc  reported a 6.4 percent fall in quarterly profit  hurt by the impact of a strong U.S. dollar.

column4: Judge trims antitrust case against Merck over potassium drug
column5: A federal judge has narrowed an antitrust class action brought by drug wholesalers alleging that Schering-Plough Corp  now owned by Merck  paid generic rivals to stay out of the market for its potassium supplement K-Dur.

column5: WASHINGTON U.S. Air Force Secretary Deborah James on Friday unveiled the first image of a new Northrop Grumman Corp long-range bomber and said it would be designated the B-21  as losing bidder Boeing Co said it would forego further challenges.

column4: Boeing says will forego further challenges to Northrop bomber deal
column5: WASHINGTON Boeing Co on Friday said it would forego any further challenges to an estimated $80 billion U.S. Air Force bomber contract awarded to Northrop Grumman Corp last year.

column5: Nu Skin Enterprises Inc will pay $47 million to settle a lawsuit that alleged the skincare products maker operated a pyramid scheme in China and made false and misleading statements about its operations in the country.

column4: Brazil's Petrobras obtains $10 bln financing from China

column4: Most holders want Sete Brasil to file for creditor protection  sources say
column5: SAO PAULO  Feb 26 Most shareholders in Sete Brasil Participações SA plan to endorse a proposal for the ailing rig leaser to seek bankruptcy protection after efforts to secure a long-term contract with sole client Petróleo Brasileiro SA failed  four sources familiar with the situation said on Friday.

column4: Fitch Rates WBC's Series 2016-C2 USD1.35bn Covered Bonds 'AAA'; Outlook Stable
column5: (The following statement was released by the rating agency) SYDNEY  February 25 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned Westpac Banking  Corporation's (WBC  AA-/Stable/F1+) Series 2016-C2 USD1.35bn mortgage covered  bonds a rating of 'AAA'. The Outlook is Stable. This brings the total  outstanding issuance to AUD27.2bn. The fixed-rate bond is due in February 2021   and benefits from a 12-month extendable maturity. KEY RATING DRIVERS The rating is based on WBC's Long-Term Issuer Default Rating (IDR) o
